channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple bags of rubbish dumped on Tooley Street/Magdalen St outside Screwfix, 26th October
item.description:
This rubbish has now been sitting there for nearly for fortnight and nothing has been done about it either via the street cleaners or otherwise. I live at St Lukes Court, 124-126 Tooley Street and have walked passed this daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Tooley Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road subsiding, 26th October
item.description:
Road subsiding following recent repair (October 14th) Needs monitoring as it continues to get worse. Junction of New Road and Monks Close SE2.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard missing, 26th October
item.description:
The bollard at Croydon road has been missing for over a month. We have observed that cars are traveling very fast at night. This is creating a significant safety hazard and, if not addressed quickly, will likely lead to another accident soon. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 319, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Neighbour at 219 is dumping their rubbish outside, 26th October
item.description:
The neighbour at 219 leaves their rubbish left on the pavement. (I can confirm it is them as their address shows on some of the rubbish) The loose rubbish has taken over the pavement at times, flown into the road, will attract pests and creates an unpleasant appearance for the whole street. For the sake of a clean and pleasant environment, please contact them about placing their rubbish inside the designated wheelie bin(s).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped home clearance, 26th October
item.description:
Someone has dumped the contents of a home clearance on the road. Please can it be cleaned?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mount Pleasant Hill, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a drain cove adjacent to 84 Petts Wood Road which seems to be partially subsiding. Every time a car or bus goes over drain you can hear the lid collapsing gradually getting worse. Sooner or later its going to collapse into the underlying drain., 26th October
item.description:
The drain cover in the road adjacent to 84 Petts Wood Road is about to collapse into the underlying drain. Every time that a Bus, Car Ambulance there is crashing sound. I fear that there could be a crash. I has some yellow paint markings so I assume somebody has identified it as faulty however its been weeks since identified and it getting progressively worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Variety of black bags and suitcases dumped today, 26th October
item.description:
Various bags dumped on Sunday 26th between 1.30pm and 4.15pm beside the clothing bin which as ever , acts as dumping ground

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kemble House - Rubbish & Recycling, 26th October
item.description:
The Rubbish and Recycling systems need to be improved. Some of the general waste bins are without lids which often leads to bin bags being placed on the floor or on top of the bins. More waste and recycling bins are needed, and they need to have lids to stop the rats and mice getting in. There should be a proper bin store here too so it looks better.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barrington Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Everywhere, 26th October
item.description:
Whole road needs to be cleaned. weeds, rubbish bags, litter, large planks of wood, food packets and newspaper all over the road,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ridgway Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti. Broken Planters. Leaves. Litter, 26th October
item.description:
The whole of Angell Road and Angell Park Gardens needs a good clean. There are leaves all over pavements, weeds, blocked drains, broken, overgrown planters on the corner of Overton Road and Angell Park Gardens, graffiti on the Loughborough Estate Sign, fly-posters and graffiti on the phonebox, stickers and graffiti over the Angell Road sign, and the notice board on the junction with Barrington Road is covered in graffiti and fly posters.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overton Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several dog waste bags, 26th October
item.description:
Several more dog waste bags have been left in the alleyway since it was last cleaned up. Appears to be the same person as the bags are the same as last time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in the alleyway, 26th October
item.description:
Lots of bulky waste items have been left in this alley way several weeks (maybe even months) ago. It’s a massive eyesore for those who access their properties via this alley. Additionally there is an overflowing commercial bin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webb Street, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: 2 inch deep pothole opposite Coop Streatham Hill., 26th October
item.description:
Recent construction and limited room for going around the pothole. Pothole seems to be a square cutout left by construction crew. About 2 inches deep

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sternhold Avenue, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside of 219 Kilburn lane, 26th October
item.description:
There is rubbish constantly on Kilburn lane, every single day. Every day I walk outside my door there is someone’s bin contents on my door step. The council tax is one of the highest in London and due to this we expect our streets to be clean. I have attached pictures of today’s mess on the street, but it is like this every single day. Please please can something be done about this? I believe it is because some houses do not have wheely bins so they have to put their bin bags on the street and foxes get into them, then the wind blows the rubbish everywhere. This has been an issue since I moved here last December

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn Lane, North Kensington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped sofa and other materials, 26th October
item.description:
Sofa was dumped 3 weeks ago and needs to be removed. Located next to recycling bins in from of John Brent block

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bush Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fox - health risk, 26th October
item.description:
A fox consistently manages to get into the basement of Berkeley Court. There are children that have access to the basement. The fox might bite someone if it feels threatened in a confined space risking giving rabies. Foxes also spread disease. Its climbing all over the vehicles in the basement and has been leaving its pee and other waste all over the cars and everywhere in the basement. This can be a health risk for the residents. In addition, there is further risk of eating cables under the vehicle that can have life risking consequences. Ive asked the building management to do something about this but over a year later they have done nothing and now the fox is more at ease to keep returning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glentworth Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet
